item.title: Global disease resurgence in 2024 highlights growing health threat - Business Standard
item.description:
Global Disease Resurgence in 2024 Highlights Growing Health Threat

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: Airfinity Ltd.

The article discusses the alarming rise in infectious diseases in 2024, driven by climate change, decreasing vaccination rates, and new pathogen variants. It emphasizes the need for a coordinated global health response.

  • Record dengue cases exceed 13 million globally, surpassing last year's figures.
  • Significant increase in whooping cough cases.
  • Surge in mpox, oropouche fever, and poliomyelitis cases.
  • Unprecedented number of avian influenza cases in the US, with 61 infections reported.
  • Rwanda reports its first outbreak of Marburg virus.
  • Extreme climate conditions aiding the spread of vector-borne diseases.
  • Declining vaccination rates post-Covid-19 pandemic contributing to disease resurgence.
“The resurgence of preventable and climate-sensitive illnesses highlights the importance of adhering to preventive measures while advancing innovation to address diseases.” - Kristan Piroeva, Airfinity Analyst

Addressing the resurgence of infectious diseases requires bolstered vaccination efforts and global cooperation in health surveillance.

item.title: "I Deserve It. Let India Decide...": What Manu Bhaker Told Father On Khel Ratna Snub - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Some Orders Being Followed: Manu Bhaker's Father Hints At Khel Ratna Snub 'Conspiracy'

Publication Date: July 29, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Manu Bhaker, despite her remarkable achievements including two bronze medals at the Paris Olympic Games, has been snubbed for the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award by the Sports Ministry. Her father, Ram Kishan, implies a questionable decision-making process within the committee, voicing their belief that she is deserving of the award and criticizing the lack of respect for Olympic medalists.

  • Manu Bhaker won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, making history for female shooters in India.
  • Her father claims there may be a conspiracy behind the lack of recommendation for the prestigious Khel Ratna award.
  • There is a contrast between the Sports Ministry's claim that Manu did not apply for the award and her father's assertions of multiple applications.
  • Her absence from the nominees list has disappointed many supporters, further fueled by previous controversies surrounding her social media posts.
"Despite such a fantastic performance if Manu is not recommended for Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna, then I am forced to believe that all is not well in the committee, or some orders were being followed." - Ram Kishan

This controversy raises questions about the integrity of the awards process and highlights the challenges faced by athletes in India. Manu Bhaker's story reminds us of the need for recognition and support for those who achieve excellence in sports.

item.title: Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Centre ends ‘no-detention policy’ for Classes 5, 8 students; Tamil Nadu says won't scrap it

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Centre's decision to eliminate the ‘no detention policy’ for Classes 5 and 8 has been met with resistance from the Tamil Nadu government, which will continue its current policy to support underprivileged students.

  • The Union government scrapped the ‘no detention policy’, allowing failure in year-end exams for Classes 5 and 8.
  • Tamil Nadu education minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi criticized the decision as detrimental to underprivileged students.
  • The state will draft its own State Education Policy and maintain automatic promotions for its schools.
  • At least 18 states and Union Territories have already abolished the ‘no detention policy’.
  • No child can be expelled from any school until completing elementary education.
“The current method of no detention policy will continue,” said Tamil Nadu's Education Minister.

Despite the Centre's changes, Tamil Nadu remains committed to its educational practices aimed at supporting less privileged students.

item.title: 'I am alive because…': Vinod Kambli clutches doctor's hand, gives first statement from hospital bed - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Emotional Hospital Statement: Grateful to Doctors

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, recovering from clots in his brain, expressed profound gratitude to his doctors for saving his life during an emotional hospital statement while receiving treatment in Thane.

  • Kambli was hospitalized due to clots in his brain, reportedly in critical condition.
  • He recounted a touching moment of holding his doctor’s hand and thanked them for their care.
  • His condition deteriorated recently after suffering from a urinary infection.
  • Despite past financial struggles, Kambli expressed commitment to rehabilitation if offered help by the cricket community.
  • Acknowledged support from fans and the medical team during his recovery.
"I am alive because of the doctors here. All I would say is that I will do whatever sir (referring to the doctor) asks me to. People will see the inspiration that I'll give them," said Kambli.

Kambli's ongoing recovery brings hope, as he remains grateful for the support from both healthcare professionals and fans, highlighting a poignant chapter in his life.

item.title: Vinod Kambli is fine, says his friend Marcus Couto after ex-cricketer is hospitalized - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli is fine, says his friend Marcus Couto after ex-cricketer is hospitalized

Publication Date: Recent Date Source: The Times of India

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, has been hospitalized, but his friend Marcus Couto has reassured fans that Kambli is fine.

  • Kambli has been struggling with health issues recently.
  • Couto emphasizes that Kambli's condition is stable.
  • The cricketing community is concerned but hopeful about Kambli's recovery.
“Vinod is fine, and there is no need to panic,” said Couto.

This incident has raised awareness about health issues faced by retired athletes and the importance of regular health check-ups.

item.title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment on December 24; Steps to check status online - CNBCTV18
item.description:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment today; Steps to check status online

Published on: December 24, 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO share allotment is finalized today, with successful bidders receiving shares in their demat accounts and refunds for non-allottees initiated on December 26.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed 81.88 times, with bids for over 170 million shares against 2.08 million shares available.
  • Subscription details show Institutional Buyers oversubscribed by 166.33 times, while Retail Investors were oversubscribed by 26.80 times.
  • Investors can check their allotment status through BSE, NSE, or Link Intime India.
  • Share credit and refunds will occur on December 26, with a listing date set for December 27.
  • The IPO price band was set between ₹269 and ₹283 per share, raising ₹840.25 crore.
"Successful bidders will see shares credited to their accounts, while non-allottees will receive refunds on December 26."

The event marks a significant milestone for DAM Capital Advisors Ltd, enhancing its financial offerings in the IPO market.

item.title: Former US President Bill Clinton hospitalised with fever - The Times of India
item.description:
Former US President Bill Clinton Hospitalized with Fever

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

Former President Bill Clinton has been hospitalized due to a fever. The details surrounding his condition have not been fully disclosed.

  • Bill Clinton, the 42nd President of the United States, has been experiencing health issues.
  • He is receiving treatment and is in the care of medical professionals.
  • The public is concerned about his health and well-being.
"We are monitoring his condition closely and are hopeful for a speedy recovery." - spokesperson

Clinton's hospitalization has raised public concern, highlighting his ongoing health challenges.

No notable quotes or statistics were provided in the article.

item.description:
Aquarius Daily Horoscope Today, December 24, 2024

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Today presents opportunities for growth and new experiences, enhancing both personal and professional aspects of life. Stay open to change and trust your instincts.

  • Aquarius should explore fresh paths and perspectives.
  • Financial stability allows focus on relationships and self-care.
  • Embracing new ideas fosters personal growth.

  • Work relationships are strengthened by sharing innovative ideas.

item.title: Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More - News18
item.description:
Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

Apple is planning to enhance its smart home product lineup with Face ID-enabled smart door cameras by 2025, aiming to compete with established players like Google and Amazon.

  • Apple is focusing on the smart home market, targeting a launch by late 2025.
  • Face ID technology could replace traditional door keys, allowing user access through facial recognition.
  • The new product may integrate with Apple's existing devices or be compatible with third-party smart locks.
  • Apple aims to alleviate privacy concerns associated with face data, which may not be as prevalent with competitors.
  • This move is seen as essential for Apple to revive sales, especially in light of stagnation in its core iPhone market.
Apple feels the security of Face ID makes it reliable enough to be integrated for doors.

In conclusion, Apple's venture into smart home security with Face ID could reshape consumer perceptions of home safety and convenience, potentially enhancing its market presence.

item.title: India to be key challenge as Honda, Nissan talk merger - The Times of India
item.description:
India to be Key Challenge as Honda, Nissan Talk Merger

Publication Date: October 20, 2023

Source: Times of India

Honda and Nissan are in talks about a potential merger, highlighting India as a significant challenge for their collaboration.

  • Both companies face fierce competition in the Indian automotive market.
  • They need to navigate local regulations and consumer preferences.
  • The merger could create opportunities for cost-sharing and innovation.
"This merger could transform the landscape of the automobile industry in India," said an industry expert.

The merger discussions between Honda and Nissan signal a strategic move to bolster their positions in the competitive Indian market.

item.title: World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa - The Times of India
item.description:
World's most expensive Indo-US NISAR satellite likely to be launched in March: Nasa

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the anticipated launch of NASA's Indo-US NISAR satellite, which is deemed the most expensive satellite of its kind. Scheduled for March, this satellite aims to enhance Earth observation capabilities.

  • The NISAR satellite represents a collaborative effort between India and the USA.
  • It is designed to monitor changes in the Earth's surface and understand various environmental processes.
  • The project emphasizes advanced technology and international cooperation in space exploration.
"The NISAR satellite is expected to revolutionize our understanding of the planet's ecosystems and natural disasters."

This launch signifies a notable milestone in international space collaboration, aiming to bring valuable data for scientific research and environmental monitoring.

item.title: Israel acknowledges assassinating former Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh in Iran - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Israel Confirms Assassination of Hamas Leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: HT News

Israel has acknowledged the assassination of former Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, resulting in heightened fears of regional conflict and prompting military responses from the US.

  • Haniyeh was killed in an explosion on July 31 in Tehran.
  • Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz emphasized intentions to target Houthi leaders similarly.
  • The attack escalated tensions, leading the US to deploy additional military resources to the region.
  • Haniyeh was involved in negotiations for a ceasefire in Gaza prior to his death.
“Anyone who raises a hand against Israel will have his hand cut off.” - Israel Katz

This event has significant implications for the ongoing violence in the region and may lead to increased military engagements by Israel and its adversaries.

item.title: Bangladesh writes diplomatic note to India seeking return of Sheikh Hasina - The Indian Express
item.description:
Bangladesh Demands Sheikh Hasina's Extradition from India for 'Judicial Process'

Date & Source: January 13, 2023, from The Indian Express

Bangladesh has officially requested India to send back former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to face trial for 'crimes against humanity and genocide'. The International Crimes Tribunal in Dhaka has issued arrest warrants for Hasina and several of her associates. The Indian Ministry of External Affairs has confirmed receiving the extradition request.

  1. Bangladesh's interim government has sent a diplomatic note to India for Hasina's extradition.
  2. The India-Bangladesh extradition treaty allows provisions for refusing requests based on certain grounds.
  3. Hasina's presence and statements in India have strained bilateral ties with Bangladesh.
“We have sent a note verbale to the Indian government saying that Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process.” - Touhid Hossain, Foreign Affairs Advisor, Bangladesh

Conclusion: The extradition request could impact India-Bangladesh relations and will require delicate diplomacy.

item.title: Yogi Adityanath impresses delegation with nearly 2-minute opening remark in Japanese | Video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yogi Adityanath Delivers Opening Remarks in Japanese, Signs MoU with Yamanashi Prefecture

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: HT News

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath impressed a Japanese delegation with his nearly two-minute opening remarks given in Japanese, which received wide applause.

  • Yogi Adityanath welcomed Kotaro Nagasaki, Governor of Yamanashi Prefecture, and highlighted the cultural ties between India and Japan.
  • An MoU was signed to promote industrial development, tourism, and vocational education collaboration between Uttar Pradesh and Yamanashi.
  • Adityanath expressed hope for economic and cultural exchanges and emphasized the shared values strengthening India-Japan ties.
“Had a productive meeting and fruitful discussion with Mr. Kotaro Nagasaki... Looking forward to exploring new opportunities for economic and cultural exchange together,” said Yogi Adityanath.

This meeting represents a significant step towards enhancing bilateral relations and collaboration between India and Japan.

item.title: Justin Baldoni's apology to wife Emily resurfaces amid Blake Lively's sexual harassment lawsuit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Baldoni Apologizes to Wife Emily Amid Blake Lively's Sexual Harassment Lawsuit

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Justin Baldoni's wedding vows, where he apologized to his wife Emily, have resurfaced in the context of Blake Lively's ongoing sexual harassment lawsuit against him.

  • Baldoni publicly acknowledged his shortcomings during his wedding vows.
  • The resurfacing of the clip coincides with Lively's serious allegations against Baldoni.
  • Lively claims harassment and a hostile work environment during the filming of 'It Ends With Us.'
  • Lively's lawsuit also mentions a smear campaign against her, which Baldoni's lawyer refutes.
“I’m sorry for all my faults, my shortcomings, for my insecurities and my ego...” - Justin Baldoni

This unfolding drama highlights issues in Hollywood regarding workplace conduct and personal accountability.

item.title: Vitamin D has no role to play in preventing fractures: New Research - The Times of India
item.description:
Vitamin D has no role to play in preventing fractures: New Research

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

New research from the US Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) indicates that Vitamin D supplements do not prevent falls or fractures in older adults.

  • The USPSTF recommends against taking Vitamin D with or without calcium for older adults aged 60 and over who live at home.
  • Falling is a primary cause of injury in older adults, but increases in risk of kidney stones have been noted with unnecessary supplementation.
  • Effective preventive services for falls include screening for osteoporosis and structured exercise programs.
  • The recommendations do not apply to those taking Vitamin D for medical reasons or individuals diagnosed with conditions affecting Vitamin D absorption.
“Unfortunately, when we reviewed the latest evidence, we found that taking vitamin D with or without calcium does not prevent falls or fractures in older adults.” - John M. Ruiz, Ph.D., USPSTF member.

The findings emphasize the need for alternative preventive methods for maintaining bone health in older adults.

item.title: Pakistan plans to purchase 40 Chinese J-35 stealth fighter jets - The Times of India
item.description:
Pakistan Plans to Purchase 40 Chinese J-35 Stealth Fighter Jets

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Pakistan is set to enhance its air force capabilities by acquiring 40 advanced J-35 stealth fighter jets from China, marking a significant development in its military procurement strategy.

  • This deal aims to strengthen Pakistan's defense mechanisms amid regional tensions.
  • The J-35 jets are expected to provide modern aerial capabilities.
  • The acquisition reflects Pakistan's growing defense cooperation with China.
“This deal highlights our commitment to modernizing our military assets.”

This purchase underscores the importance of strategic partnerships in defense procurement as nations seek to fortify their military capabilities.

item.title: Yemen bears highest burden of cholera globally: WHO - Xinhua
item.description:
Yemen Faces Highest Cholera Burden in the World, Reports WHO

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Xinhua

The World Health Organization has indicated that Yemen has the most significant burden of cholera globally, with alarming rates of suspected cases and fatalities reported this year.

  • Yemen recorded 249,900 suspected cholera cases by December 1, 2024.
  • There were 861 associated deaths in the same timeframe, representing 35% of the global cholera burden.
  • Year-on-year, cases and deaths surged by 37% and 27% respectively compared to November 2023.
  • The WHO stated that the cholera outbreak worsens due to poor health infrastructure and waterborne disease outbreaks.
  • Efforts to combat cholera are hindered by conflict and a lack of healthcare access.
“The outbreak of waterborne diseases like cholera and acute watery diarrhea imposes an additional burden on an already stressed health system facing multiple disease outbreaks.” - Arturo Pesigan, WHO representative

The situation in Yemen concerning cholera remains critical, stressing the need for effective humanitarian aid and improved healthcare access.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G confirmed to launch in India: Expected price, features, and specs | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G Confirmed for India: Price, Features, and Specs

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: OPPO India

Oppo has officially confirmed the launch of its Reno 13 series 5G smartphones in India, following the success of the Reno 12 series. The release will feature two models: Reno 13 5G and Reno 13 Pro 5G, with significant design upgrades and innovative specifications.

  • Launch details were teased, although the exact date is not yet available.
  • Design upgrades include a premium aluminium frame and a sculpted glass back.
  • The devices will feature a triple-camera setup with a unique triangular design.
  • Display specifications include a 6.59-inch AMOLED display, 2760x1256 resolution, 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset with a 5,600mAh battery and 80W fast charging.
  • The camera setup includes a 50MP primary sensor with OIS and a 50MP front camera for selfies.
  • Running on ColorOS 15 based on Android 15.
  • Expected pricing in China starts at CNY 2,699 (approx. ₹31,400), with Indian pricing yet to be announced.

“Familiar, yet so refreshingly new. Can you guess what’s coming?” — OPPO India (@OPPOIndia) December 23, 2024

The upcoming launch is aimed at appealing to both camera enthusiasts and gamers, promising high performance and cutting-edge technology.

item.title: Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shyam Benegal dies: Akshay Kumar, Manoj Bajpayee and Shekhar Kapur mourn demise of veteran filmmaker, call him 'legend'

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Shyam Benegal, celebrated Indian filmmaker, passed away on December 23 at the age of 90. His death has prompted an outpouring of tributes from Bollywood celebrities who remembered him as a legend and visionary in Indian cinema.

  • Benegal had recently celebrated his 90th birthday.
  • He was known for his pioneering work in Indian parallel cinema.
  • His daughter confirmed his passing, citing the great loss it represents.
  • He won multiple National Awards and was honored with Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan.
“Pained to know of Shyam Benegal ji’s demise. One of the finest filmmakers in our country, truly a legend. Om Shanti.” - Akshay Kumar
“A heartbreaking loss for Indian cinema...his legacy will live on in the stories he told and the lives he touched.” - Manoj Bajpayee

Benegal's influence on Indian cinema is celebrated widely, and his legacy as a storyteller will continue to inspire future generations.
